What dynamics govern them? How does an average community evolve over time? And, most importantly, how does one start a community around an interest or a goal? To answer these questions, we started putting together this community building playbook as a public good. And we invite you to co-create it with us! Distilling community building to a formula is no simple task, and it is also not our intention here. Instead, we aim to open a two-way dialogue with the reader, and discuss the general direction we should move in. As a result, this public good may seem incomplete, and it shall always be so. As community members, we are all well aware of the infinite ways in which communities rise and fall. To add to this complexity, technological developments often disrupt established processes and ground rules. As a result, the community building meta keeps changing. The rules of building a decentralized, digital community differ from building, say, an irl community. This playbook mainly focusses on the former type of communities, and highlights the concepts and practices that seem to work in this domain.
